newsitem.title: DENMARK: SOCCER-FC COPENHAGEN WIN DANISH CUP.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FC COPENHAGEN WIN DANISH CUP.

text.p: FC Copenhagen overcame a spirited challenge from outsiders Ikast to win the Danish Cup final 2-0 on Thursday.
After a goalless first half, watched by a smaller than expected crowd of 17,368, superleague Copenhagen went ahead through Carsten Hemmingsen in the 72nd minute.
Ikast, first division leaders and on course for promotion after losing just once in 21 games, continued to push forward but could not find a way through.
Copenhagen clinched the victory, their second cup success in three years, when David Nielsen headed the second six minutes from time.
The win was a welcome morale-booster for FC Copenhagen, fourth from the bottom of the 12-team superleague.
Formed in 1992 from a merger between KB Copenhagen and B1903 Copenhagen, they still face a fight to avoid relegation.
